posts.cooked:
Hi,

I‚Äôm getting the following error when trying to link SDL with MinGW32 when building Urho3D as a shared library:

[quote]Linking CXX shared library C:\Urho3D\Bin\Urho3D.dll
‚Ä¶\ThirdParty\SDL\libSDL.a(SDL_mmjoystick.c.obj):SDL_mmjoystick.c:(.text+0x37): undefined reference to joyGetNumDevs@0' ..\ThirdParty\SDL\libSDL.a(SDL_mmjoystick.c.obj):SDL_mmjoystick.c:(.text+0xa2): undefined reference tojoyGetPosEx@8‚Äô
‚Ä¶\ThirdParty\SDL\libSDL.a(SDL_mmjoystick.c.obj):SDL_mmjoystick.c:(.text+0xc3): undefined reference to joyGetDevCapsA@12' ..\ThirdParty\SDL\libSDL.a(SDL_mmjoystick.c.obj):SDL_mmjoystick.c:(.text+0x602): undefined reference tojoyGetPosEx@8‚Äô
Engine\CMakeFiles\Urho3D.dir\build.make:5784: recipe for target ‚ÄòC:/Urho3D/Bin/Urho3D.dll‚Äô failed
CMakeFiles\Makefile2:939: recipe for target ‚ÄòEngine/CMakeFiles/Urho3D.dir/all‚Äô failed
Makefile:135: recipe for target ‚Äòall‚Äô failed
c:/mingw/bin/‚Ä¶/lib/gcc/mingw32/4.8.1/‚Ä¶/‚Ä¶/‚Ä¶/‚Ä¶/mingw32/bin/ld.exe: ‚Ä¶\ThirdParty\SDL\libSDL.a(SDL_mmjoystick.c.obj): bad reloc address 0x20 in section `.eh_frame‚Äô
collect2.exe: error: ld returned 1 exit status
mingw32-make[2]: *** [C:/Urho3D/Bin/Urho3D.dll] Error 1
mingw32-make[1]: *** [Engine/CMakeFiles/Urho3D.dir/all] Error 2
mingw32-make: *** [all] Error 2
23:55:55: The process ‚ÄúC:\MinGW\bin\mingw32-make.exe‚Äù exited with code 2.
Error while building/deploying project Urho3D (kit: Desktop)
When executing step ‚ÄòMake‚Äô[/quote]

My CMake configuration is -DURHO3D_OPENGL=1 -DURHO3D_LIB_TYPE=SHARED and the output:

[quote]-- The C compiler identification is GNU 4.8.1
‚Äì The CXX compiler identification is GNU 4.8.1
‚Äì Check for working C compiler: C:/MinGW/bin/gcc.exe
‚Äì Check for working C compiler: C:/MinGW/bin/gcc.exe ‚Äì works
‚Äì Detecting C compiler ABI info
‚Äì Detecting C compiler ABI info - done
‚Äì Check for working CXX compiler: C:/MinGW/bin/g++.exe
‚Äì Check for working CXX compiler: C:/MinGW/bin/g++.exe ‚Äì works
‚Äì Detecting CXX compiler ABI info
‚Äì Detecting CXX compiler ABI info - done
‚Äì Using SSE2 instead of SSE because SSE fails on some Windows ports of GCC
‚Äì Disable SSE with the CMake option -DURHO3D_SSE=0 if this is not desired
‚Äì Looking for include file stdint.h
‚Äì Looking for include file stdint.h - found
‚Äì Looking for include file wbemcli.h
‚Äì Looking for include file wbemcli.h - not found
‚Äì Building SDL without DX joystick support due to missing wbemcli.h
‚Äì For MSVC, get it from Windows 7 SDK. For MinGW, get it from eg. Wine sources or from MinGW-w64
‚Äì Performing Test COMPILER_HAS_DEPRECATED_ATTR
‚Äì Performing Test COMPILER_HAS_DEPRECATED_ATTR - Success
‚Äì Found Urho3D: as CMake target
‚Äì Configuring done
‚Äì Generating done
‚Äì Build files have been written to: C:/Urho3D/Build[/quote]

I got an error previously because I was missing ddraw.h which I took from directx-devel.tar.gz. I don‚Äôt quite get why would I need anything from DirectX if I‚Äôm compiling with URHO3D_OPENGL set to true, but I have installed DirectX (Jun 2010) just in case.

Both compilation and linking go smoothly if I try to build Urho3D as a static library. I also have a different issue trying to compile in debug mode with Assimp‚Äôs object sizes being too large:

[quote]Building CXX object Engine/CMakeFiles/Urho3D.dir/Physics/PhysicsWorld.cpp.obj
c:/mingw/bin/‚Ä¶/lib/gcc/mingw32/4.8.1/‚Ä¶/‚Ä¶/‚Ä¶/‚Ä¶/mingw32/bin/as.exe: CMakeFiles\Assimp.dir\code\IFCReaderGen.cpp.obj: too many sections (33064)
C:\Users\Pablo\AppData\Local\Temp\ccAqKUoY.s: Assembler messages:
C:\Users\Pablo\AppData\Local\Temp\ccAqKUoY.s: Fatal error: can‚Äôt write CMakeFiles\Assimp.dir\code\IFCReaderGen.cpp.obj: File too big
c:/mingw/bin/‚Ä¶/lib/gcc/mingw32/4.8.1/‚Ä¶/‚Ä¶/‚Ä¶/‚Ä¶/mingw32/bin/as.exe: CMakeFiles\Assimp.dir\code\IFCReaderGen.cpp.obj: too many sections (33064)
C:\Users\Pablo\AppData\Local\Temp\ccAqKUoY.s: Fatal error: can‚Äôt close CMakeFiles\Assimp.dir\code\IFCReaderGen.cpp.obj: File too big
ThirdParty\Assimp\CMakeFiles\Assimp.dir\build.make:2769: recipe for target ‚ÄòThirdParty/Assimp/CMakeFiles/Assimp.dir/code/IFCReaderGen.cpp.obj‚Äô failed
mingw32-make[2]: *** [ThirdParty/Assimp/CMakeFiles/Assimp.dir/code/IFCReaderGen.cpp.obj] Error 1
CMakeFiles\Makefile2:1362: recipe for target ‚ÄòThirdParty/Assimp/CMakeFiles/Assimp.dir/all‚Äô failed
mingw32-make[1]: *** [ThirdParty/Assimp/CMakeFiles/Assimp.dir/all] Error 2[/quote]

Any ideas? Thanks in advance.

posts.name: Yao Wei Tjong
posts.cooked:
The build scripts are tested almost everyday with mingw-w64 in our CI build using a Linux build system and cross-compiling for Windows as target system. It can build for both 32- and 64-bit despite its name. The MinGW32 has not been thoroughly tested as much as MinGW-W64, I believe.

Regarding the Assimp‚Äôs object sizes being too large issue on debug configuration build, I thought we have worked around the issue with the changes in the Assimp‚Äôs CMakeLists.txt. Have a look at this file Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/CMakeLists.txt at lines 11-16. I suppose you are not cross-compiling so the workaround does not kick in. Can you try to remove the CMAKE_CROSSCOMPILING in the if condition and report back if it solves the issue. Thanks.

Thanks a million to both of you for the hint.

I downloaded MinGW-w64 for Windows and the shared library compilation worked out of the box. No need to copy ddraw.h etc as in MinGW32 because it‚Äôs already within the w64‚Äôs include folder.
I had to change the lines weitjong suggested to compile the debug version, though. I left it as follows:

[quote]if (MINGW)
# The IFCReaderGen.cpp.obj has too many sections in DEBUG configuration build
# Since GCC does not support /bigobj compiler flags as in MSVC, we use optimization flags to reduce the object file size
set (CMAKE_C_FLAGS_DEBUG ‚Äú${CMAKE_C_FLAGS_DEBUG} -O1‚Äù)
set (CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_DEBUG ‚Äú${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_DEBUG} -O1‚Äù)
endif ()[/quote]

Anyway, is quite a strange thing that MinGW32 is not able to get some SDL symbols if compiled as a shared library.

posts.name: Yao Wei Tjong
posts.cooked: Thanks for the confirmation. I have removed the CMAKE_CROSSCOMPILING condition check in the latest master branch.

I tried to compile the 32bit version of Urho3D and I ran into some problems. It turns out I didn‚Äôt get the proper MinGW-w64 version to do so.
In case someone‚Äôs interested, this is what worked for me:

Download the MinGW-w64 installer from http://sourceforge.net/projects/mingw-w64/files/Toolchains%20targetting%20Win32/Personal%20Builds/mingw-builds/installer/mingw-w64-install.exe/download
Select the following options when installing. I chose GCC 4.8.3 to have the same stable version I have in the rest of OS‚Äôs.

My issue was that I left the exception model by default: which is seh, and is only compatible for 64bits. The compiler was throwing the following error at the very beginning of the compilation (cstdlib):

error: expected unqualified-id before ‚Äò__int128‚Äô inline __int128

To know more about the exception handling and the thread model of MinGW-w64: http://qt-project.org/wiki/MinGW-64-bit

I hope it helps.

link_counts.title: Download MinGW-w64 - for 32 and 64 bit Windows from SourceForge.net

posts.cooked:
I use mingw 4.8.2 i686 posix dwarf rev3
also i try 4.9.0 i686 posix dwarf rev2
working good
